editorialSummary.text: Unassuming rooms in a down-to-earth hotel featuring a restaurant & free breakfast.

text.text: Booked the room after seeing the positive reviews but it was a wrong decision. I booked their room through their website for 1 day, which costed me Rs.1050. The room was very small and the bedsheets were not clean. It was all covered with dust and hair particles. No remote for controlling ac, you have to do it with bare hands. No ammenties were provided, not even water. During checkout, I was charged for water as well as extra room charge just for handling the water bottle, which is a basic ammenties for a room. Overall not a very good experience.

text.text:
The hotel is conveniently located very close to Lucknow Station, making it a good choice for travelers. The rooms are decent and comfortable overall. However, they do charge extra for early check-in and late check-out, which could be a downside for some.

The main drawback is the lack of proper maintenance—towels were not fully clean, the geyser and toilet flush weren’t functioning properly, and one room had no TV service due to an expired Tata Sky subscription. Even a single bottle of water is chargeable. With improved upkeep and attention to guest comfort, this hotel could offer a much better experience.

text.text:
Wonderful Stay with Excellent Service!

I had a fantastic experience at this hotel. The staff was extremely courteous and always ready to assist, making my stay comfortable and hassle-free. A special mention to Mr. Raza and Mr. Shivam, the reception managers, who were very helpful, well-behaved, and ensured smooth check-in and check-out.

The hotel is neat and clean, with well-maintained rooms that provide a cozy and relaxing ambiance. All essential services like laundry, room service, and housekeeping were prompt and efficient. Breakfast was delicious and complimentary for guests who opted for it, while those who booked only the room could still enjoy excellent room service.

Booking through MakeMyTrip was seamless, and the hotel offered great flexibility in choosing stay options. Overall, a highly recommended place for a comfortable and enjoyable stay. Will definitely visit again!

editorialSummary.text: Functional budget hotel, for Indian nationals only, offering warmly decorated rooms & breakfast.

text.text:
Absolutely Horrible Experience – Avoid at All Costs!
I wish I could give this place zero stars because it doesn't even deserve one. Staying here was the worst decision ever!
•	Filthy Rooms: The pillows were disgustingly dirty and smelled awful. Clearly, they haven't been washed in ages!
•	No Cleaning: Housekeeping is nonexistent. The entire place was dusty, smelly, and completely unhygienic.
•	Cockroach Infestation: Yes, cockroaches in the room! If that doesn’t scream unlivable, I don’t know what does.
•	Disgusting Staff: The staff members looked just as dirty as the place itself. Unprofessional and completely indifferent to guest complaints.
•	No Proper AC: The AC barely worked, making the room hot and suffocating. With zero ventilation, it felt like a sauna.
•	No Maintenance: Everything was falling apart, from the bathroom fittings to the walls. Clearly, no one cares about upkeep.
•	No Essentials: No towels, no soap, nothing! They don’t even bother to provide the bare minimum for guests.
•	Not Safe for Families: I wouldn’t bring my worst enemy here, let alone my family. It’s simply unfit for human stay.
Save yourself from this nightmare and stay far, far away!

text.text:
My stay was absolutely awful. The issues started right from the moment I entered the room. The bed sheets were torn and dirty, and the blanket had visible stains. To make things worse, the room was crawling with cockroaches, and cleanliness seemed to be completely absent.

The pictures online are incredibly misleading; the rooms are much smaller in person. The staff was rude, arrogant, and showed no willingness to help or address the problems. To top it off, the water heater wasn’t working, and the breakfast served was cold, tasteless, unhygienic, and completely unappetizing.

I’m thankful to Treebo for stepping in and changing my hotel after one day, which salvaged the rest of my trip. However, the initial experience here was so bad that I wouldn’t recommend this place to anyone.

If you’re considering booking this hotel, I urge you to look elsewhere. I have pictures to prove how bad the condition of the room was. Overall, this was one of the worst hotel stays I’ve ever had.

text.text:
🛑 Worst Hotel Experience Ever – Avoid at All Costs!

I had a terrible experience at this place. The room was extremely dirty — filthy tiles, moldy bathroom corners, stains on the mattress, and unwashed bedsheets. It looked like it hadn’t been cleaned in weeks! The toilet was in horrible condition, and the walls were damp and peeling. Absolutely unhygienic and unacceptable!

To make things worse, the hotel staff asked me to leave before completing 24 hours and demanded extra charges without any valid reason. This is not just unprofessional — it feels like a scam.

No basic cleanliness, no hospitality, no value for money. I wouldn’t recommend this place to anyone. Save yourself the regret and book somewhere else!

⭐ Rating: 1/5 (only because 0 stars isn’t allowed)

text.text:
Location : Very close to metro gate no. 1 of charbagh station and Lucknow junction.
Lallan the helper boy was extremely kind and good in his service. He came to pick us from station and help us with the luggage.

Room : Take the room on 2nd floor as 1st floor is getting renovated.  We opted for the room for 2 nights with king bed, cupboard and single seater sofa at 1600/ night ( Pictures attached)

Manager : Vijay sharma , the young manager was extremely polite and good at his work and positive to deal with . However another manager ( uncle looking) santosh Dwivedi was exactly OPPOSITE. He was rude and very impolite and had no manners to talk to a girl and deal with customer.
Santosh was absolutely unpleasant to deal with . I don't think he is even apt for a role of front desk executive.
He is someone who is responsible for all the negative I can think of about the sharma regency hotel .

Owner : Saurabh is polite and good at his communication skills. He could speak fluent English which was an advantage as I was with foreign national tourist.
I recommend him to shift the rude impolite unpleasant manager santosh from front desk and shift him somewhere else if he wants good reviews and wants to give good overall experience to the customers

Safety : Although the area is known for notorious reasons, this hotel in our experience was safe. Although, avoid going 9 pm to 7 am.

Food : Manoranjan sweet house was excellent for breakfast and dinner. The tea was one the best I have had . It was walkable from the hotel.

Overall - Decent experience due to the rude manager Santosh Dwivedi but good experience if I deduct him from the picture.

text.text: I am a foreigner and have booked through the website and paid. When it was time to check in, they refused my stay because I did not have the immigration stamp picture. But I showed them my visa and passport front with the picture. They were able to check through the computer system because I did not carry my real passport. This is the first time I have been to a cheap hotel and was treated badly. The counter staff did not seem to know anything and did not seem to be educated. How should I talk to customers? When I asked to speak to the hotel owner, they refused. If the hotel owner reads this, please call your counter staff to retrain them on service. Because if I do not pass the immigration, how can I stay in India? Do not ask for the immigration stamp. Check the date of entry, check when the visa expires. The hotel system, I think you can check but said no. I will only look at the stamp in the real passport. What is this nonsense? I will always remember this hotel as the worst hotel of the year.

text.text:
Must Read and see photos - Worst Experience Ever - Filthy and Infested!

I recently had the unfortunate experience of staying at FabHotel Prime Mohan, and I must say it was an absolute nightmare from start to finish. I cannot stress enough how terrible this place was, and I strongly advise anyone considering staying here to run in the opposite direction. I wouldn't wish this experience upon my worst enemy.

Let's start with the basic amenities that were supposed to be provided. The bed in my room was not only uncomfortable but also tilted at an absurd angle. I felt like I was sleeping on a roller coaster ride, and getting any decent sleep was impossible. To make matters worse, the room was infested with dust everywhere. It was as if housekeeping hadn't bothered to clean for weeks, if not months.

The tea tray and other items in the room were shockingly dirty. I couldn't bring myself to touch anything without feeling disgusted. The level of cleanliness was nonexistent, and it was evident that hygiene standards were completely disregarded. In fact, during my stay, I encountered cockroaches roaming around freely. To add insult to injury, I even found a cockroach shell in the room. This was beyond unacceptable.

But the misery didn't end there. The air conditioning unit was a complete disaster. Instead of providing a cool and comfortable environment, it produced a noise that resembled a generator. It was impossible to relax or concentrate with that constant racket. I can only assume that the maintenance of the hotel's facilities is severely lacking.

I can confidently say that the overall condition of the hotel was utterly unhygienic. From the dirty and tilted bed to the presence of cockroaches, it was clear that the management had no regard for their guests' comfort or well-being. This experience has left me traumatized, and I would strongly discourage anyone from staying at this establishment.

In summary, my stay at FabHotel Prime Mohan was a disaster. The bed was tilted, dust covered every surface, the tea tray and other amenities were filthy, cockroaches roamed freely, and the room was infested with a cockroach shell even found. To make matters worse, the noisy air conditioning unit made sleep impossible. The level of unhygienic conditions was appalling. Save yourself the trouble and find another hotel that actually cares about its guests' comfort and cleanliness.

text.text:
The only pro: Its less than 3Kms from charbagh station.
I happened to stay for 2 nights and was just hoping to somehow get out of the property as i had already prepaid and it was non negotiable.
I directly connected with the owner booked my room directly which was the first mistake i made, the owner assured me a deluxe room with breakfast and a checkin by 12PM for 800rs a night. And i did the advance payment and reserved a room.
But we were made to wait and got the room only at 4PM although we reached at 8AM.
We were made to change 3 rooms as they were giving only the ordinary rooms.
Later on the entire night there was no WATER and we were handed a bottle of water to do our routine.
The next day they denied the breakfast saying that it was not included at the price.
The room was undtidy and shabby, the pillows and bedsheet torn.
Moreover the behaviour of Mr. Yadav, the caretaker was very rude throughout the 2 days also the uncertain behaviour of the owner was unpleasant as well.
AVOID THE PROPERTY AT ALL COST IF YOU HAVE AN OPTION!!!!

text.text: I stayed in this hotel from 19/10/2024 to 20/10/2024 , These are my honest review , It has been my worst stay ever , I went there with my family and booked 3 rooms , the hotel is like some 3rd class lodge. It's rooms are dirty ,unmaintained and dirty and the biggest trick they will play is that they will show u some old pics of their rooms but on booking they will allot u some other room that too old and dirty one , bathrooms were big but not at all clean , Bedsheets and blankets  were smelly and rooms were small , and closed from all sides , Asked for towels they answered that all of the towels went for washing and will give them in the evening only got 2 towels for 3 rooms and 6 people, never got the rest of them , asked for room service for cleaning in night ,they answered that the boy is not here and asked some unreasonable price for cleaning some glass mug pieces, and the WORST OF ALL, The power went off at around 6 O clock in the morning and came back at 9 O Clock , we went several times to complain about it but there was no one at the reception for the entire time. We were on a fully packed trip and exhausted , and because of that we couldn't even rest peacefully.For 1000rs u will get a lot better hotels in Lucknow .

text.text: Recently constructed with contemporary facilities and budget-friendly rates, this hotel boasts excellent room service and delectable cuisine. Its prime location, directly opposite Lucknow Junction, made my two-day stay serene and enjoyable.

originalText.text: Recently constructed with contemporary facilities and budget-friendly rates, this hotel boasts excellent room service and delectable cuisine. Its prime location, directly opposite Lucknow Junction, made my two-day stay serene and enjoyable.

text.text:
It is an old hotel undergoing thorough renovations, but they have one completed floor which has decent rooms.
Its the connectivity which made this hotel valuable to me. The hotel shares a wall with the Charbagh metro station, that one can walk from the metro station right into the hotel premises in a few steps without even crossing a road.
Those train travellors getting down in Lucknow central railway station climb the escalator of charbagh metro station and walk over to the other side, and reach this hotel.  Anyone coming on a flight just reach airport metro station and travel to charbagh. Anyone coming from Delhi or elsewhere on a bus, get down at transport nagar metro station and travel here. The point is, you don't need a taxi cab to reach here.
The reception staff, and managers are all very decent and responsive. I had an issue of hot water supply not working when i arrived, they personally came to check, and even the property owners called me up to verify it was rectified. They won't let you feel disappointed.

The other staff, housekeeping, and restaurent staff are yet to catch up, and are a bit clueless. There is no dining area, and their kitchen hasn't been made functional. Tea, and breakfast were average and the services in this regard have a long long way to improve. I struggled a bit to get food for my one year old with appropriate clean utensils, and the staff could not help much.
However the online food delivery services in this area serves one in the shortest time and choices were infinite.

Rooms are pretty good for the cost they offer. TV was functional with a valid subscription, bedding was clean & decent, heater integrated AC  did a commendable job of keeping us warm quickly when the outdoors were at 6 degrees, bathroom was small but clean and warm water was available all day. All room fittings and furniture were of decent brands and were well maintained.

All rooms had windows that could not be opened, and there was nothing much to see outside other than the adjacent building  or metro station walls. Parking was in the open, but it looked safe as the area was enclosed by another dozen hotels which shared the parking area, and someone would be watchful from their receptions.
